title: Divita Kanoria's entrepreneurial venture on Aromatherapy
author: Milan Sharma
description: Kanoria began her entrepreneurial journey at an age when most women are caught in the endless cycle of playing wife and mother.
cleaned_text: entrepreneurial journey at an age when most women are caught in the endless cycle of playing wife and mother. She would have settled for the same, but a personal setback in 2002 pushed her to pursue spiritual healing through aromatherapy, which not only improved her health but also gave birth to her venture. "I was going through a bad medical phase, which was also taking a toll on my mental health. I was bed-ridden, but didn't want to give up," she says. This highlighted the vast gap in the demand and supply of products promising spiritual healing through aromatherapy. It prompted her to set up her own firm, [Vedic Collections Private Limited](/topic/vedic-collections-private-limited), in October 2009, and Tathaastu was born. In January 2011, it was rebranded 'Tatha' as it was easier to pronounce by her international clientele. The firm started with an office at Saket, 2-4 employees and a seed capital of Rs 40 lakh, which was funded by her family. Nothing in her life had prepared Kanoria for the retail world and she had to battle several hurdles, from marketing the concept to Indian buyers to procurement of glass bottles and non-performing employees. The company made its first big sale worth Rs 1 lakh in December 2009 and raked in a revenue of Rs 50 lakh in 2009-10. Besides bodycare products (creams and scrubs start at Rs 420 for a 25 gm jar) and a separate range for men, you'll find incense sticks, candles, roll-ons for memory improvement and nasal decongestion aids in her repertoire. The company broke even in 2010-11, raking in Rs 2 crore, even as her employee count has increased to 20, including the staff at her stores and spas. While she shifted her first store from DLF Promenade in Gurgaon to Galleria two months ago, another one is opening shortly at Saket. She has also partnered with [The Four Seasons Hotel](/topic/the-four-seasons-hotel)in Mumbai, while the HHI in Kolkata houses the Tatha Signature Salon for spa services. The company plans to move to tier II cities like Varanasi and Lucknow, even as it has introduced a spa-on-wheels service, Tatha Privileged Care. About a month ago, the company expanded its product repertoire to include a range of organic lounge clothes with ayurvedic herbs woven into the fabric's yarn, spiritual music CDs and organic teas. Till date she has invested around Rs 1.5 crore in her venture. Through it all, her daughter has been her biggest critic. "It encourages me to work harder," she adds. No wonder she is eyeing a turnover of Rs 4 crore.
